intro: Haplochorema oligospermum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has narrow, linear leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Haplochorema oligospermum is often found in open habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
